concept-wr.title: Licensing and Authentication
concept-wr.shortdesc: Licenses and CA-certificates are initially specified at installation time using the config_controller wizard and must be properly maintained and updated.

section.title: Updating a License
section.p: You can update a license by copying the new license file to a directory on the active controller host, and then running the license-install utility as shown in the following example:

note.p: Wind River recommends that you update licenses before they expire. Manual recovery of VMs may be required if the license is upgraded after expiry.

section.title: Operational Behavior with Expired or Invalid Licenses
section.p: Titanium Server and Titanium Server CPE assume the operational behavior described below when an expired or invalid license is detected.
Mismatched licenses are considered invalid. For example, a Titanium Server license is considered an invalid license if the server is installed and provisioned as a Titanium Server CPE product.
Expired and invalid licenses cause the following behavior:

li.p: A service log (401.003) is logged every 1 hour.
A service alarm (400.003) is triggered 8 hours after the expired or invalid license is detected, and every 1 hour thereafter.
72 hours after the expired or invalid license is detected for the first time, the controller stops service.
